intro: Chisocheton nicobarianus, commonly known as the Nicobar satinwood, is a tropical tree native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces woody capsules containing flat, winged seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
